page.title: 10VILLAGE LIFE IN GUARLFORD
page.content: The hamlet of{Guarlford}is first memtioned in Thirteenth Century records but probably existed a century before , as one of the settlements within the woodland and common land of{Malvern Chase.}During {Tudor}times the land was enclosed when he died in 1558 John Badger , lessee of Guarlford Manor , left 9 oxen , 12 catle , 2 bulls , 9 yearlings and 10 calves , 6 horses of varying ages 22 sheep and 46 lambs 4 swine and grain worth Â£20.The land around{Guarlford}is still farmed on a small scale,the hedged fields remaining largely unaltered since 1900.
